archaic_italian: Io non posso più sostenere il peso di tante sciagure.
english_translation: I can no longer bear the weight of so many misfortunes.

archaic_italian: In questo loco già furon grandi uomini che il mondo onoraro.
english_translation: In this place once stood great men who honored the world.

archaic_italian: Né tempo né oblio potranno cancellar le sue imprese.
english_translation: Neither time nor oblivion shall erase his deeds.

archaic_italian: Conobbi allor che l’amor vero è eterno.
english_translation: I then knew that true love is eternal.

archaic_italian: Chi troppo alto sale, cade sovente più dolorosamente.
english_translation: He who climbs too high often falls more painfully.

archaic_italian: Ogni creatura obbedisce al volere de lo ciel.
english_translation: Every creature obeys the will of heaven.

archaic_italian: Or vedi come il destino talora è beffardo.
english_translation: Now you see how fate can be mocking.

archaic_italian: Né sorte né fortuna poteron mutare il suo animo.
english_translation: Neither fate nor fortune could change his spirit.

archaic_italian: Ecco il tempo che ogni cosa manifesta.
english_translation: Behold the time when everything is revealed.

archaic_italian: Quando il sole calava, il mondo si tingeva di sangue.
english_translation: When the sun set, the world was stained with blood.

archaic_italian: Costui visse con onore e morì con gloria.
english_translation: This man lived with honor and died with glory.

archaic_italian: Tutta la città tremava al suon delle campane.
english_translation: The whole city trembled at the sound of the bells.

archaic_italian: Per amor di patria, molti perirono con animo lieto.
english_translation: For love of country, many perished with cheerful spirit.

archaic_italian: I venti parlavano di tempi antichi e leggende perdute.
english_translation: The winds spoke of ancient times and lost legends.

archaic_italian: Lo spirito del tempo non può esser domato.
english_translation: The spirit of time cannot be tamed.

archaic_italian: Udii parole sì dolci che il core n'ebbe pietà.
english_translation: I heard such sweet words that my heart was moved.

archaic_italian: Nel silenzio della notte, l'anima trovò pace.
english_translation: In the silence of night, the soul found peace.

archaic_italian: Ella camminava come chi ha lasciato ogni speranza.
english_translation: She walked as one who has abandoned all hope.

archaic_italian: Nulla v'è di più certo che l'incertezza del fato.
english_translation: There is nothing more certain than the uncertainty of fate.

archaic_italian: Con gli occhi pieni di lacrime, benedisse il tramonto.
english_translation: With eyes full of tears, she blessed the sunset.

archaic_italian: Il re si mostrò giusto e misericordioso.
english_translation: The king showed himself just and merciful.

archaic_italian: Così parlò il vecchio saggio, poi svanì nel nulla.
english_translation: Thus spoke the old sage, then vanished into nothing.

archaic_italian: Di quel che fummo, non resta che polvere e memoria.
english_translation: Of what we were, only dust and memory remain.

archaic_italian: Quando la neve cadeva, ogni rumore si taceva.
english_translation: When the snow fell, every sound grew silent.

archaic_italian: L’antico castello era pieno di misteri e segreti.
english_translation: The ancient castle was full of mysteries and secrets.

archaic_italian: Ella non ebbe timor della morte, ma del dimenticar.
english_translation: She did not fear death, but being forgotten.

archaic_italian: Colui che cerca verità, troverà dolore.
english_translation: He who seeks truth shall find sorrow.

archaic_italian: Sotto la luna, le anime perdute cantavano.
english_translation: Under the moon, lost souls sang.

archaic_italian: Le stelle guidavano i marinai nelle notti oscure.
english_translation: The stars guided sailors through the dark nights.

archaic_italian: E pur si move, disse il vecchio astronomo.
english_translation: And yet it moves, said the old astronomer.

archaic_italian: Il viandante seguiva la via senza sapere il destino.
english_translation: The wanderer followed the path without knowing his fate.

english_translation: I can no longer bear the weight of so many misfortunes.
